newsitem.title: UK: UK's Clarke says sees no EMU by 1999.
newsitem.headline: UK's Clarke says sees no EMU by 1999.

text.p: Britain's Chancellor of the Exchequer Kenneth Clarke said on Wednesday that he did not think that Euroepan economic and monetary union (EMU) would start on the planned launch date of January 1 1999.
"I actually don't think that (the single currency) is going to go ahead on on time -- but I think we (Britain) will keep our options open," Clarke told BBC radio.
Clarke said that businessmen both in the UK and abroad wanted to see the British government taking a "sensible, detached" view on what is in the best interests for British jobs and prosperity.
The Chancellor addded that Britain remained committed to its position within the European Union.
